Description: Rim and body sherd of pottery plate; dull white slip (very worn); interior: trace of black on rim (edge now lost); possible maeander pattern on floor bounded by narrow brown line; possible tongue pattern; exterior: worn slip, three brown lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.483)
